description.narrative: Barefeet Theatre is a non-governmental organization that uses play, creativity, and empowerment (such as arts and drama) to give vulnerable children in Zambia a chance at a better life. Barefeet was founded by former street children as a response to the pl ight of young people living on the streets. This project is about the Children's Council of Barefeet theatre. The Children's Council is a group of about thirty enthusiastic, passionate and articulate young activists from the surrounding communities of Lus aka, each representing one of Barefeet?s partner centres (childcare facilities or schools for vulnerable children), a total of about 2000 children. The council advocates for issues that are pertinent to them and their peers in Zambia (HIV/AIDS, drugs, home lessness, suicide, abuse). Central to their ethos is the adherence to the Convention on the Rights of the Child. The project intends to see 1. Barefeet Children?s Council having professionalism in its work. 2. The relevant government agencies and community at large increasing its resources in dealing with abuse cases and working with street children and utilizing the knowledge and experience of actors like BCC. 3. the setting up of two new Children?s Councils in new areas of Zambia: Kaoma and Livingstone.
